      • getErrorMessages

        java.util.List getErrorMessages()
        Returns the error messages resulting from translating an expression.
        Returns:
        the list of error messages

      • getErrorMessagesAsString

        java.lang.String getErrorMessagesAsString(boolean aFormatted,
                                          boolean aEscapeQuotes)
        returns the error messages as a String
        Parameters:
        aFormatted - true if messages should be formatted using Rule-Message, false for raw, newline delimited messages
        aEscapeQuotes - true if quotations should be escaped so that message may itself be used within a quoted string
        Returns:
        non-null String (zero length if no errors)

      • getMustHaveVariable

        boolean getMustHaveVariable()
        retrieve the indicator that the caller wants to force the generation of an intermediate variable for this expression. (allows When blocks to compute the expression once and use the result both as the value of the When and as an epilog parameter)
        Returns:
        true if an intermediate variable is required

      • getUseIfPresent

        boolean getUseIfPresent()
        Gets the flag that indicates that getIfPresent should be used instead of getProperty to resolve property references.
        Returns:
        true if somePage.getIfPresent is in use

      • setUseIfPresent

        void setUseIfPresent(boolean aUseIfPresent)
        Sets the flag that requests the expression code generator to use getIfPresent instead of getProperty to resolve property references.
        Parameters:
        aUseIfPresent - true if somePage.getIfPresent should be used.

      • getAvoidJavaPropertyLookup

        boolean getAvoidJavaPropertyLookup()
        Gets the flag that indicates that Java property lookup should be avoided during getIfPresent of property.
        Returns:
        true if the flag is true iff somePage.getIfPresent is being used.

      • setAvoidJavaPropertyLookup

        void setAvoidJavaPropertyLookup(boolean aAvoidJavaPropertyLookup)
        Sets the flag that indicates that Java property lookup should be avoided during getIfPresent of property. This flag is applicable only if UseIfPresent is true.
        Parameters:
        aAvoidJavaPropertyLookup -

      • setGeneratedType

        void setGeneratedType(int aGeneratedType)
        Sets the generated type. Allowed values are CodeGenerator.TYPE_* values
        Parameters:
        aGeneratedType - the generated type to set

      • setForcePAndCLookup

        void setForcePAndCLookup(boolean aForcePAndCLookup)
        Sets the flag that indicates that the embedded expression contains a relative reference that MUST be looked up in Pages & Classes. Note: absolute references are searched in Pages & Classes by default.
        Parameters:
        aForcePAndCLookup - true iff the flag should be set to true

      • getForcePAndCLookup

        boolean getForcePAndCLookup()
        Gets the setting that forces lookup of relative references in Pages & Classes
        Returns:
        true if this relative reference MUST be looked up Pages and classes.

      • isTertiaryVariableNameOnly

        boolean isTertiaryVariableNameOnly()
        Returns:
        true if the tertiary buffer contains only a variable name.
